required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Clinical Efficacy of Postpartum Immunization of Rh and Coombs Negative Women With Sensitization Risk.
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of the Clinic Efficacy of Immunoglobulin Anti-RhD KamRho-D® (Panamerican) in Postpartum Immunization of Rh-negative and Coombs Negative Women at Sensitization Risk.

collaborator.agency: Panamerican Medical Supply Suprimentos Médicos Ltda.

brief_summary.textblock: The anti-Rh immunoglobulin is an immunobiological containing high concentration of specific antibodies against factor D and "neutralizes" D antigen present in the Rh-positive fetal red blood cells (Rh +), which passed into the bloodstream of Rh-negative pregnant women (Rh). This a immunization study for clinical assessment of anti-Rh immunoglobulin (KamRho-D®) in Rh and Coombs negative women with risk sensitization.

detailed_description.textblock: This a immunization, non-randomized phase III study in which women participants with RH and Coombs negative receive only one dose of 1500 IU anti-Rh immunoglobulin intramuscularly and will be following during six months to verification of negative Coombs maintenance. Safety evaluation data will include report of all adverse events (including type, frequency, intensity, seriousness, severity and action taken related to the investigational product).

primary_outcome.measure: The primary endpoint will be the maintenance of the negative result for the indirect Coombs test 06 months after delivery, proving that the test drug had the same ability to neutralize possible fetal red blood cells.
primary_outcome.time_frame: 72 (+6) hours after immunization; 90 days after immunization and 180 days after immunization.

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence, intensity, type and frequence of adverse event.

intervention.description: KamRho-D (Immunoglobulin Anti-RhD): single dose (300mcg/2mL), via intramuscular, up to 72h after delivery.

facility.name: Centro de Pesquisa da MEAC - Maternidade Escola Assis Chateaubriand

investigator.last_name: Francisco Edson de Lucena Feitosa, MD

facility.name: Instituto Tropical de Medicina Reprodutiva e Menopausa -INTRO
Associação Educadora São Carlos AESC - Centro de Pesquisa HRPC
Hospital de Clínicas de Porto Alegre
